title: Actors pushing back against Hollywood’s medical tyranny
cleaned_text:
Entertainers in Hollywood have pushed back against medical tyranny coming in the form of Wuhan coronavirus (COVID-19) vaccine mandates.

Speaking to the Epoch Times, many Hollywood actors revealed that they have been essentially ostracized in the entertainment scene for refusing to get injected with the COVID-19 shot. They also disclosed that they have sent more than 800 emails to the Screen Actors Guild-American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (SAG-AFTRA) about its vaccine mandate, all of which remain unanswered.

According to the actors, their request for a religious exemption from vaccination has been ignored despite a return-to-work agreement established by SAG-AFTRA that explicitly says producers must consider them.

In one recent email to SAG-AFTRA President Fran Drescher, director Ed Rollin of “Summer of ’70” fame wrote: “No business that I know of, including our own government, requires testing before you enter a building.” Drescher, best known as the lead actress in the TV sitcom “The Nanny,” was elected SAG-AFTRA president in 2021.

Actress and stuntwoman Michelle Jubilee Gonzalez, a member of the group pushing back against vaccine mandates, disclosed to the Epoch Times that she developed both reproductive and cardiac-related health problems immediately after getting a COVID injection. The vaccine was mandatory for her to continue working in different movie productions.

“SAG-AFTRA is no longer running like a member-run union, but rather a tyranny with [SAG-AFTRA Executive Director] Duncan Crabtree-Ireland at the helm,” Gonzalez lamented. “It is criminal what is happening under his usurped leadership.”

Things came to a head when SAG-AFTRA and the Alliance of Motion Picture & Television Producers decided to extend COVID-19 vaccine mandates and other protocols for members. (Related: Hollywood VAX BRAINWASH: No more movies made until every actor, director, and producer gets the clot shots in the name of “humanity’s better nature.”)

Actors themselves speak out against vaccine mandate

Even actor Woody Harrelson, who recently appeared in the 2022 film “Triangle of Sadness,” mocked SAG-AFTRA’s COVID-19 vaccine mandate by means of an unscripted monologue. He performed the said monologue on the Feb. 25 edition of “Saturday Night Live.”

“The movie goes like this,” he said. “The biggest drug cartels in the world get together and buy up all the media and all the politicians, and force all the people in the world to stay locked in their homes. People can only can come out if they take the cartels’ drugs and keep taking them over and over.”

“I threw the script away. I mean, who’s going to believe that crazy idea?”

Also on Feb. 25, actress Maya Dunbar told the Epoch Times that refusing the COVID-19 vaccines has become like the “scarlet letter” in Hollywood. “Thousands of us [have] been gaslit, demeaned and kept out of meetings,” lamented the actress who has previously appeared in shows such as “Harry’s Law” and “The Mentalist.”

Dunbar admitted that she initially understood the criticism lobbed against vaccine skeptics during the pandemic’s early days. However, she eventually changed her mind after evidence of the shots causing more harm than good emerged – bringing into question the safety of the injections.

The actress also disclosed that the medical fascism she, her husband Rockmond Dunbar and their four children experienced was the most horrific experience their family has ever gone through.

“You have a lot of people who just don’t want to lose what they have, [such as] their worldly treasures, if that means having to shill some shots, some pills or whatever [they are],” Dunbar remarked. “This is a godless industry.”

She ultimately pointed to Hollywood’s reliance on Big Pharma advertising as the true reason why “a blind pharmaceutical kind of frenzy cult” has existed there.
